episodeTitle: Arriving at Halfway Through the Grand Line! The Red Line
description: The Straw Hat Pirates reach the Red Line, marking the halfway point of the Grand Line. While searching for a route to Fish-Man Island using the Shark Submerge III, Luffy, Robin, and Brook encounter a Sea Rabbit that attacks them and spits out two unexpected passengers: Camie the mermaid and Pappag the talking starfish.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Marine Leadership Discusses Kuma's Actions
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, Fleet Admiral Sengoku confronts Bartholomew Kuma about allowing the Straw Hat Pirates to escape after their battle with Gecko Moria. Vice Admiral Garp defends his grandson Luffy's tenacity, creating tension between the Marine leadership.
events.significance: Establishes the World Government's concern about the Straw Hats and sets up Kuma's mysterious dual allegiance, foreshadowing his complex role in the story.

quotes.text: Why did you let the Straw Hat Pirates go?
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Confronting Kuma about his failure to eliminate the Straw Hats

events.title: Straw Hats Reach the Red Line
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at the Red Line, the massive continent that divides the world. They realize they've reached the halfway point of the Grand Line and reflect on how far they've traveled from their starting point.
events.significance: A major milestone in the crew's journey, representing the midpoint of their adventure through the Grand Line and their progress toward the New World.

quotes.text: We've made it halfway through the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Realizing they've reached the midpoint of their journey

events.title: Crew Reflects on Their Journey
events.description: The Straw Hats take a moment to reflect on their journey so far, remembering the friends they've made and the adventures they've had. They discuss their dreams and how far they still have to go to achieve them.
events.significance: A quiet character moment that reinforces the themes of dreams and perseverance while acknowledging the crew's growth and the bonds they've formed.

events.title: Shark Submerge III Deployment
events.description: Franky deploys the Shark Submerge III, a three-person submarine from the Soldier Dock System Channel 3. Luffy, Robin, and Brook board it to investigate the waters beneath them and search for a route to Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: First significant use of the Shark Submerge III in the main story, showcasing Franky's engineering prowess and the Thousand Sunny's capabilities.

quotes.text: The Shark Submerge has a diving limit of 5,000 meters!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Explaining the submarine's limitations as the crew prepares to search for Fish-Man Island

events.title: Sea Rabbit Attack
events.description: While exploring in the Shark Submerge III, Luffy, Robin, and Brook are suddenly attacked by a large Sea Rabbit that emerges from the darkness and attempts to swallow the submarine whole.
events.significance: Sets up the rescue of Camie and Pappag, introducing the main new characters of this episode.

events.title: Luffy Defeats the Sea Rabbit
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Rifle to punch the Sea Rabbit, defeating it and causing it to spit out the contents of its stomach, including two unexpected passengers.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's combat abilities and sets up the introduction of Camie and Pappag.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Attacking the Sea Rabbit that threatened the submarine

events.title: Camie's Debut
events.description: After the Sea Rabbit is defeated, it spits out a young kissing gourami mermaid named Camie. She is rescued by the Straw Hats and brought aboard the Thousand Sunny, marking her first appearance in the anime's main storyline.
events.significance: Introduces Camie, a key character in the Sabaody Archipelago Arc who will connect the Straw Hats to Hatchan and the darker elements of the arc involving slavery and the World Nobles.

quotes.speaker: Camie
quotes.context: Expressing gratitude to the Straw Hats after being rescued from the Sea Rabbit

events.title: Pappag's Debut
events.description: Along with Camie, a talking starfish named Pappag emerges from the Sea Rabbit. He introduces himself as a fashion designer and the creator of the Criminal brand clothing line, shocking the crew with his ability to speak.
events.significance: Introduces Pappag, Camie's companion and mentor, adding comic relief while also establishing his role as a successful fashion designer which becomes relevant later in the arc.

quotes.text: I'm Pappag, the famous designer of the Criminal brand!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Introducing himself to the amazed Straw Hat crew

events.title: Sanji's Mermaid Reaction
events.description: Sanji becomes overwhelmed with excitement upon meeting Camie, a real mermaid. His exaggerated reaction to seeing a mermaid for the first time provides comic relief and showcases his characteristic behavior around beautiful women.
events.significance: A humorous character moment that reinforces Sanji's personality while building anticipation for the crew's eventual visit to Fish-Man Island, a place full of mermaids.

quotes.text: A real mermaid! She's so beautiful!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Reacting with extreme excitement to meeting Camie

events.title: Camie and Pappag's Relationship Explained
events.description: Camie and Pappag explain their unusual relationship: Camie is both Pappag's owner (she takes care of him) and his apprentice (he's teaching her fashion design). This unique dynamic establishes their bond and Camie's dream of becoming a designer.
events.significance: Provides character depth for both Camie and Pappag while establishing Camie's personal dream and ambitions beyond just being a mermaid.

events.title: Camie Mentions Her Missing Friend
events.description: Camie expresses concern about her friend who has gone missing, hinting at a larger problem. She mentions needing help to find him, setting up the next phase of the arc.
events.significance: Foreshadows the upcoming rescue mission that will lead the Straw Hats into conflict with the Flying Fish Riders and eventually to Sabaody Archipelago, where they'll encounter Hatchan.

quotes.text: We've made it halfway through the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Realizing the crew has reached the Red Line

quotes.text: I'm Pappag, the famous designer of the Criminal brand!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Introducing himself to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: A real mermaid! She's so beautiful!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Meeting Camie for the first time

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how far the Straw Hats have come, reaching the halfway point of the Grand Line. This milestone moment allows for reflection on their adventures while building excitement for what lies ahead.
themes.symbolism: The Red Line represents both an obstacle and a milestone, symbolizing the challenges they've overcome and those yet to come.

themes.description: The crew's chance meeting with Camie and Pappag demonstrates how the pirate life is full of surprises and new friendships formed in unlikely circumstances.
themes.symbolism: Being rescued from a sea monster's stomach parallels how the Straw Hats often find their strongest allies in the most unexpected situations.

themes.description: Through Camie's introduction, we learn of her dream to become a fashion designer under Pappag's tutelage, reinforcing the series' ongoing theme of pursuing one's dreams.

characterSpotlights.development: Camie is introduced as a friendly and grateful mermaid who dreams of becoming a fashion designer. Her rescue by the Straw Hats establishes her connection to the crew.
keyActions: Rescued from the Sea Rabbit by Luffy
Introduces herself and Pappag to the crew
Mentions her missing friend, setting up future events

characterSpotlights.development: Pappag is revealed to be a talking starfish and successful fashion designer, defying expectations and adding humor to the episode. His relationship with Camie as both pet and mentor is established.
keyActions: Emerges from the Sea Rabbit with Camie
Introduces himself as the designer of Criminal brand
quotes: I'm Pappag, the famous designer of the Criminal brand!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his characteristic kindness by immediately helping those in need and his combat prowess by defeating the Sea Rabbit.
keyActions: Explores underwater in the Shark Submerge III
Defeats the Sea Rabbit with Gomu Gomu no Rifle
Welcomes Camie and Pappag aboard the ship

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 385 adapts only pages 7-18 of Chapter 490, with earlier pages adapted in Episode 381 and later pages in Episode 386. The anime extends scenes with additional dialogue and reaction shots.
The Marine scene with Sengoku and Kuma receives extended dialogue and additional reaction shots in the anime that weren't present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the beginning of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc, which is widely considered one of the most important arcs in One Piece for its introduction of the Eleven Supernovas and its shocking conclusion.
The opening theme used in this episode is a remix of 'We Are!' performed by Tohoshinki (TVXQ) to commemorate the One Piece anime's 10th anniversary.
Camie originally appeared in the cover story 'Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll' (starting from Chapter 195) before making her anime debut in this episode.
The Shark Submerge III, which plays a key role in this episode, was first introduced in Episode 329 when Franky showed off the Thousand Sunny's Soldier Dock System.
Episode 385 originally aired on January 18, 2009 in Japan, while the English dub was released on DVD on July 14, 2015, over six years later.
Voice actress Haruna Ikezawa, who voices Camie in Japanese, is also known for voicing Athena Asamiya in The King of Fighters series and Coco Bandicoot.
